meanings.definition: To increase in size or quantity.
meanings.sent1: I will upsize my drink to a large at the movie theater.
meanings.sent2: She decided to upsize her order to get more food for the party.
meanings.sent3: The balloon started to upsize so much that it popped with a loud bang.
meanings.sent4: Her excitement seemed to upsize with each passing minute.
meanings.sent5: The plant began to upsize rapidly after being watered.

meanings.definition: To upgrade to a larger size or portion.
meanings.sent1: He wanted to upsize his fries to a bigger size for only a small extra cost.
meanings.sent2: The company offered to upsize their customers' orders for free.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to upsize its tiny bed by squeezing into it.
meanings.sent4: The idea to upsize their vacation plans was met with enthusiasm.
meanings.sent5: The cake looked delicious, but she wished she could upsize her slice.
